commitResults.messageBody: Level-0 increment for Week 2's iP task. Adding a simple greeting and an ASCII Art as the logo.
Second round of Level-0 increment to make the program more casual/fun - referencing marvel films. Along with some formatting of the strings.
Added skeletal functionalities for user input, then echo and repeat until user provides "bye" as the command. For Week 3 Level-1 Increment.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update to Increment Level-1.  Greet, Echo, Exit
commitResults.messageBody: Removal of the extra "ech" that was accidentally typed in and committed in previous commit.
Just a commit to move some functionalities into seperate method calls eg. the printing of greeting, farewell and logo display.
Added functionality to store text entered by user and listing them when requested

Added functionalities to mark task as done.
Extension - Implemented a "Task" class for the Task object.
Tidy up of some past increments.

OoooWeeeeeeee, definitely productive day today!

*For those who are seeing this comment and wondering what even am I even saying but its a reference to Mr Poopybutthole from a show called Rick and Morty.

Formatting of Codes to fit specified Code Style.

Personal comment/reference - IDEA IDE can format using CTRL+ALT+L
Just a simple commit to add line to close scanner

Added functionality and implemented 3 classes to track different type of tasks - Todo, Event, Deadline.

Also, I have made some changes to the function signature, (mainly the String taskType) and moved taskCounter out of the parameters.

Will do the Code Quality improvements tomorrow morning.

Weekly Nonsense - NEVER GONNA GIVE YOU UP, NEVER GONNA LET YOU DOWNNNN.
https://tinyurl.com/td23zhfc

Changed EXPECTED.TXT to really be the expected output from the respective inputs I have ran it with. Also, I have removed 2 extra trailing spaces in the logo that resulted in differences between ACTUAL.TXT and EXPECTED.TXT.

Made improvements to Code Quality by refactoring and changes to naming conventions.

Quote of the Day - Quality > Quantity but hopefully mine fulfils that criteria :(
Just some changes to input.txt and its corresponding EXPECTED.TXT
Changes to access modifers for function methods
Error handling of unknown commands and "done" command without any index input

1. Added handling for marking task as done when no task exist in list.
2. Added handling for missing todo name (a.k.a description as specified in the cs2113t webpage)

Extra - Some changes to the message text for MISSING_INDEX_MESSAGE
Addition of DukeException class.

Added the constructor for the DukeException Class. Implemented the unusual cases to trigger DukeException error messages. Also, made some changes to main function to be more abstract and cleaner, and some changes to the passing of parameters.

commitResults.messageTitle: Simple change to the add a constant value for the missing todo name message.

commitResults.messageBody: Added the DukeException Class and its constructor. Implemented the unusual cases to trigger DukeException error messages. Also, made some changes to main function to be more abstract and cleaner, and some changes to the passing of parameters. Lastly, a small change to the naming convention to error message when todo name is empty.

Organized the respective class files into suitable java packages.

Done for the day finally, tbh still pretty stressed out/panicked by the fact that my merge didn't go as I expected just because of that one checkbox I hastily missed. If only I had been more cautious, I would have been able to move on to my next task for the day. I guess that's a new experience for me (messing up commit merges) and I gotta be more careful next time round.

commitResults.messageTitle: NOTE - Not an incremental update, just a change of string values to constants.

commitResults.messageBody: Added functionalities to delete task. Also changed the implementation to use ArrayList over Arrays. Some other changes also include some additional error handling, only thing for these are the error messages left to change.
Added funtionalities to Save files upon changes (When add task and mark task as done).  As well as functionality to read from file to retrieve saved tasks and instantiate them into the list of tasks.
Just a change of filename from tasks.txt to duke.txt. And the write-to and read-from file name changes.

commitResults.messageTitle: Made some changes according to Tutor's comments

1. Removed irrelevant comments, that I had forgotten to take out previously after changing to ArrayList
2. Using "Returns the..." in the javadocs instead.
3. Changed to a more meaningful name for the splitted array.

commitResults.messageBody: Extracted UI related functionalities to Ui class and some changes to code, such as the removal of taskCounter to instead use arrayList.size() and additional printing function on Ui
Forgot to remove the prompting for user input which belongs to Ui and some changes to the method modifiers (eg. the static, public vs private). And remov

Removing of unnecessary imports and methods in Duke.java
There is also some parsing methods in there, will move them over to the Parser class in the next few commits.

commitResults.messageTitle: Small commit to resolve warning messages in Intellij and removing some dangling javadocs
Moved constructed error messages over to DukeException class.

commitResults.messageBody:
1. Added Parser class to contain the functionalities related to parsing commands and then calling the respective commands.
2. TaskList class to contain the List of Task and functionalities relating to tasks.
Minimal requirement for Level-8, storing deadlines dates as a LocalDate Object and printing in a different format for these deadline dates.

commitResults.messageTitle: Small bug fix, regarding changing of duke.txt's date parameter in the file. The format was causing issues, upon second run.
